subject: Law
title: Duress and Undue Influence
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Duress and Undue Influence.

hook.text: Sign this contract or I'll destroy your business. You sign. That contract is voidableâ€”you were coerced.

buildup.text: Duress means one party was forced to agree through threats, violence, or wrongful pressure.

discovery.text: Undue influence is subtler: exploiting a position of trustâ€”like a caretaker pressuring an elderly person.

twist.text: Economic duress counts too. Threatening to breach a critical contract unless terms are renegotiated can qualify.

climax.text: The victim can void the contract, but must act promptly. Waiting too long implies acceptance of the terms.

punchline.text: Consent under pressure isn't real consent.

quiz.question: What is the difference between duress and undue influence?
options: Duress uses threats; undue influence exploits trust
